001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
008import java.util.Set;
009
010/**
011 * The Motor Safety feature acts as a watchdog timer for an individual motor. It operates by
012 * maintaining a timer that tracks how long it has been since the feed() method has been called for
013 * that actuator. Code in the Driver Station class initiates a comparison of these timers to the
014 * timeout values for any actuator with safety enabled every 5 received packets (100ms nominal).
015 *
016 * <p>The subclass should call feed() whenever the motor value is updated.
017 */
018public abstract class MotorSafety {
019  private static final double kDefaultSafetyExpiration = 0.1;
020
021  private double m_expiration = kDefaultSafetyExpiration;
022  private boolean m_enabled;
023  private double m_stopTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
024  private final Object m_thisMutex = new Object();
025  private static final Set<MotorSafety> m_instanceList = new LinkedHashSet<>();
026  private static final Object m_listMutex = new Object();
027
028  /** MotorSafety constructor. */
029  public MotorSafety() {
030    synchronized (m_listMutex) {
031      m_instanceList.add(this);
032    }
033  }
034
035  /**
036   * Feed the motor safety object.
037   *
038   * <p>Resets the timer on this object that is used to do the timeouts.
039   */
040  public void feed() {
041    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
042      m_stopTime = Timer.getFPGATimestamp() + m_expiration;
043    }
044  }
045
046  /**
047   * Set the expiration time for the corresponding motor safety object.
048   *
049   * @param expirationTime The timeout value in seconds.
050   */
051  public void setExpiration(double expirationTime) {
052    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
053      m_expiration = expirationTime;
054    }
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Retrieve the timeout value for the corresponding motor safety object.
059   *
060   * @return the timeout value in seconds.
061   */
062  public double getExpiration() {
063    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
064      return m_expiration;
065    }
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Determine of the motor is still operating or has timed out.
070   *
071   * @return a true value if the motor is still operating normally and hasn't timed out.
072   */
073  public boolean isAlive() {
074    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
075      return !m_enabled || m_stopTime > Timer.getFPGATimestamp();
076    }
077  }
078
079  /**
080   * Check if this motor has exceeded its timeout. This method is called periodically to determine
081   * if this motor has exceeded its timeout value. If it has, the stop method is called, and the
082   * motor is shut down until its value is updated again.
083   */
084  public void check() {
085    boolean enabled;
086    double stopTime;
087
088    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
089      enabled = m_enabled;
090      stopTime = m_stopTime;
091    }
092
093    if (!enabled || RobotState.isDisabled() || RobotState.isTest()) {
094      return;
095    }
096
097    if (stopTime < Timer.getFPGATimestamp()) {
098      DriverStation.reportError(getDescription() + "... Output not updated often enough.", false);
099
100      stopMotor();
101    }
102  }
103
104  /**
105   * Enable/disable motor safety for this device.
106   *
107   * <p>Turn on and off the motor safety option for this PWM object.
108   *
109   * @param enabled True if motor safety is enforced for this object
110   */
111  public void setSafetyEnabled(boolean enabled) {
112    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
113      m_enabled = enabled;
114    }
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Return the state of the motor safety enabled flag.
119   *
120   * <p>Return if the motor safety is currently enabled for this device.
121   *
122   * @return True if motor safety is enforced for this device
123   */
124  public boolean isSafetyEnabled() {
125    synchronized (m_thisMutex) {
126      return m_enabled;
127    }
128  }
129
130  /**
131   * Check the motors to see if any have timed out.
132   *
133   * <p>This static method is called periodically to poll all the motors and stop any that have
134   * timed out.
135   */
136  public static void checkMotors() {
137    synchronized (m_listMutex) {
138      for (MotorSafety elem : m_instanceList) {
139        elem.check();
140      }
141    }
142  }
143
144  public abstract void stopMotor();
145
146  public abstract String getDescription();
147}
